text:
Laser diodes are currently limited to about 5W of output power under ideal conditions, which means that any diode laser with a higher power will have multiple diodes. This introduces a problem in that it is very difficult to get all the beams lined up, so the beam is often not very well focused. You will note that I said OUTPUT power. The problem with a lot of diode lasers you might find on Aliexpress or Ebay is that the seller is listing the INPUT electrical power, which is usually about 4 to 5 times the output power. Yep, most of the input power gets turned into heat. 

A diode laser with a genuine 40W output will consume a least 160W, and will be turning about 120W of the input power into heat. That's if you actually have a 160W power supply for it. If it doesn't have a massive heatsink, it probably isn't a 40W laser.

So you need to be careful when buying a diode laser, particularly a cheap one from China. Your 40W diode laser is probably only giving you 5W or 10W of actual output power.
video: Watch This Before Buying a Laser Cutter & Engraver

You missed a setting that will speed things up without using Offset Fill 

Open your layer settings - go to the advanced tab and switch flood fill on to get the same/similar times as offset fill, but with the normally oriented scan lines

text: Machines, that have a single printhead, can print CMYK with the upper half of nozzles and white with lower half of nozzles. Dual printheads, meaning one for CMYK and one for white, are probably in a staggered configuration so all of the nozzles can be used for printing.

text: I have all those lasers, even the Omtech from your shop and I would not recommend any of them after having them. The Omtech and the Destop CO2 both have the air pump inside the case and contaminate the lenses with smoke, causing them to die quickly. LED lasers these days have the finer focus for engraving but lack proper air flow and exhaust management. It might sound strange, but I have a LED laser for engraving with smoke extraction, and a 80W CO2 with all features extrenal ( Air compressor, cooler, extraction fan ) I have not found any good all-in-one laser as of today. I thought the 50W Omtech would be the one, but that grilled a set of lenses in a day.
video: Watch This Before Buying a Laser Cutter & Engraver

text: I don‚Äôt believe the water chiller is included with the machine, and shipping costs are an additional expense. This is worth considering when comparing brands. Based on quotes for machines of the same size (1300mm), the OneLaser is about 24% more expensive than the Pronto, claims to be 20% faster, and offers the option of an RF laser. To my knowledge, neither machine uses servo motors like the Thunder Laser. It‚Äôs a very capable machine and may have better support than some competitors. However, it‚Äôs a new brand with no established track record, although it appears to be closely associated with Thunder Laser, which has a solid reputation. Definitely tempting.

text:
I‚Äôm really considering this one‚Äîthe price is amazing for something that‚Äôs on par with Trotec or Epilog. Even with shipping, it‚Äôs still super competitive compared to most professional lasers out there. What‚Äôs even better is that they‚Äôre planning to roll out extra features and lifetime upgrade options, which could turn this into the ultimate cabinet CO2 laser. It‚Äôs definitely shaping up to be a solid choice.

On the flip side, I‚Äôve never used thunder machine but I had some experience with the OMTECH Pro series, and honestly, omtech services sucks, the speed didn‚Äôt match the advertised claims, and the bed would occasionally tilt, causing alignment issues and other issues here and there.‚Äîso I‚Äôm glad Onelaser stepping it up with a better game.

What I really like about OneLaser is their U.S.-based team. They‚Äôre super responsive and actually take the time to answer questions properly, which you don‚Äôt see often. The only drawback? You‚Äôve got to wait 2-3 months for inventory, but they‚Äôve promised stock is on the way. Hopefully, they deliver on that soon!
